results.title: Chiostri e cortili
results.creator_credit: Ubaldo Magnachi and Istuto Nazionale Luce
results.brief_description: An exploration of the architectural beauty and historical associations of cloisters and courtyards in and around Rome. Includes views of San Giovanni in Lateran, Santa Maria del Angeli and some of the work of Michelangelo. Commentary is in Italian.

results.title: Chinese legends, gods and prophets
results.creator_credit: Sumner J. Glimcher and Mass Communications
results.brief_description: An introduction to oriental myth, religion and philosophy from the Shang Dynasty, 1766-l122 BC, to rites connected with ancestor worship as practised today in Taiwan.

results.title: China: changes from within (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Focuses on the manifestations of social economic and political changes that are taking place in China. These changes will take place over a long time, however the atmosphere which has allowed them is evidence of a trend towards a more ‘democratic socialism’.

results.title: China. Part 3. Life in the city
results.brief_description: Shows daily life in Peking, including scenes of schooling, shopping, religious ceremonies, and construction of new blocks of flats and a causeway. Describes the emphasis placed on health and fitness. Edited version of “China!”.

results.title: China. Part 2. Life in the country
results.brief_description: Reveals China as a land of contrasts. Shows sheep herding in the Sunkiang province, terraced hillsides planted with rice in the more temperate areas, inland lakes and rivers which provide fish, life in country towns, and harvesting activities. Edited from “China!”.

results.title: China. Part 1. History and culture
results.brief_description: Descibes China’s early history, the war with Japan, the revolution and rise of communism. Shows modern industry and transport, the city of Shanghai, Chinese theatre, story telling and musical performances. Edited from the feature documentary ‘China!’

results.title: China!
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene and Dateline Film Productions
results.brief_description: Felix Greene spent several months and travelled over 15,000 miles throughout China to make this visual report on the day-to-day life of the Chinese people. Covers agriculture and industry in various parts of the country and discusses the political situation. Also features aspects of Chinese culture and social customs. Contains b&w archival footage. Music recorded in China by Felix Greene with the Peking Symphony Orchestra conducted by Li Teh-Lun.

results.title: Chilean nitrate: gift of the desert
results.brief_description: Visualises the mining, refining and transportation of nitrate of soda in the Attacama Desert of Northern Chile. Tells of the discovery of the deposits by two American Indians. Shows the magnitude of refining operations in the area, stressing the isolation that employees of the industry must face. Describes a new form in which the nitrate can be readily stored in ships. States the importance of the industry to Chile.

results.title: Chilean hacienda: a traditional farm estate
results.creator_credit: Clifford J. Kamen and Hollywood Film Enterprises
results.brief_description: A relatively small part of Chile is suitable for farming but in this part are large farm estates, many owned by the descendants of the Spaniards who originally settled there. Employing as many as 1,000 employees, each hacienda will have its own shopping centre, school, and hospital. The employees give some of their time in payment for housing etc and also receive wages. The products are wheat, fruit, cattle, potatoes, and similar farm products. Amusements include dancing and rodeos. The haciendas are the core of the farming system of an agricultural nation.

results.title: Children who draw pictures (TEFC)
results.brief_description: With colour sequences. A study of artistic activities of first grade children in a Tokyo primary school. Through the year they experiment with pencil, crayon, finger painting, oil and clay, showing development of individual observation. Shows how school and home experiences influence choice and treatment of subjects, and how feelings are communicated in creative effort.
